definitions.definition: to hit somebody/something hard with your fist (= closed hand)

examples.text: He was kicked and punched as he lay on the ground.
He was **punching the air** in triumph.
She punched him on the nose.
I punched the pillow in frustration.
His attacker had punched him hard in the face.
She playfully punched him on the arm.
He punched the other boy in the stomach.

definitions.definition: to make a hole in something with a punch or some other sharp object

examples.text: The machine punches a row of holes in the metal sheet.

definitions.definition: to press buttons or keys on a computer, phone, etc. in order to operate it

examples.text: I punched the button to summon the elevator.

definitions.definition: to be or try to be more successful than others in doing something that normally requires more skill, experience, money, etc. than you have

examples.text: This player seems to be able to constantly punch above her weight.
He punched above his weight as the party’s foreign affairs spokesman.

wordOrigin: verb sense 1 and verb sense 3 late Middle English (as a verb in the sense ‘puncture, prod’): variant of pounce. verb sense 2 early 16th cent.: perhaps an abbreviation of puncheon, or from the verb punch ‘hit somebody/​something hard’.
